intro: Achyranthes corymbosa, commonly known as the Indian mallow, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known species like cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, open habitats. Its fibrous roots and hairy stems are notable botanical features.
